Quinctii deprehendis in publico; <cit><quote lang="la">conaris abducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">abduce me hinc ab hac, quantum potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abductus a mari atque ab lis copiis, quas, etc.... frumento ac commeatu abstractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam eum, qui sit rhetori tradendus, abducendum protinus a grammaticis putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Hispanos omnes procul ab nomine Scipionis ex Hispania abduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: tu dux, tu comes es; tu nos abducis ab Histro. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:119" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut collegam vi de foro abducerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine certamine inde abductae legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo (illum) abductum in ganeum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abduxi exercitum ad infestissimam Ciliciae partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos in lautumias abduci imperabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">liberos eorum in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum extra convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">acc</hi>. only: tollite me, Teucri; <cit><quote lang="la">quascumque abducite terras (= in terras),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 601</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n55.3" n="b" level="4">Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">donec (avem) in diversum abducat a nidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:33:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n55.4" n="c" level="4">. Sometimes also of inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">clavem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluteos ad alia opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita retro ab ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam a faucibus ac summo pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:145" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam alicui (=deducere, defiectere),</quote> <trans><tr>to divert, draw off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 26</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <trans><tr>to take away, deprive of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 477</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n55.5" n="B" level="2">In partic. </sense><sense id="n55.6" n="1" level="3"><hi rend="ital">To take with one</hi> to dine: <cit><quote lang="la">tum me convivam solum abducebat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advenientem ilico abduxi ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 9 al.</bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n55.7" n="2" level="3"><hi rend="ital">To take aside</hi> (in mal. part.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam in cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense><sense id="n55.8" n="3" level="3"><hi rend="ital">To carry away forcibly, to raxish, rob</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem iste deduxerat Tertiam, Isidori mimi flliam, vi abductam ab Rhodio tibicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 31</bibl>, § 81; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 362</bibl>: aliquam alicui (marito, <cb n="ABEO" /> etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam gremils,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 79</bibl></cit>. —So also of stolen cattle, <hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Geryonis) armenta liercules abduxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:22:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">abducta armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 359</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n55.9" n="4" level="3">In jurid. lang.: auferre et abducere, <hi rend="ital">to take and drive away</hi> (auferre of inanlmate things, abducere of living beings, as slaves, cattle), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 27, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:57:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 57, § 1</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n55.10" n="II" level="1"><usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n55.11" n="A" level="2">In gen., <hi rend="ital">to lead away, separate, distinguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad se ipsum advocamus, secum esse cogimus, maximeque a corpore abducimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aciem mentis a consuetudine oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinationem caute a conjecturis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n55.12" n="B" level="2">In partic. </sense><sense id="n55.13" n="1" level="3"><hi rend="ital">To seduce, alienate</hi> from fidelity or allegiance: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones a Bruto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ab illo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum a consule,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 12, 27</bibl></cit> al.</sense><sense id="n55.14" n="2" level="3">From a study, pursuit, duty, etc., <hi rend="ital">to withdraw, draw off, hinder</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">avoco, averto): vos a vostris abduxi negotlis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo studio te abduci negotiis intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">abducuntur homines nonnumquam etiam ab institutis suis magnitudine pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 12</bibl></cit> (followed by ab humanitate <hi rend="ital">deducere</hi>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a meretricio quaestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a populorum rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab isto officio incommodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 8 al.</bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n55.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring down, reduce, degrade</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne ars tanta...a religionis auctoritate abduceretur ad mercedem atque quaestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 92</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad hanc hominum libidinem ac licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90:section=210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90, § 210</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abductio: <entryFree id="n56" type="main" key="abducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abduco, I.B. 3.</etym>. <sense id="n56.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forcible carrying off, ravishing, robbing</hi>, Cod. Th. 4, 8, 5, § 5; 11, 10, 1. —</sense><sense id="n56.1" n="2" level="3"> (Of a woman.) <hi rend="ital">Abduction</hi>: in abductione Hesionae, Dares Phryg. 4. —</sense><sense id="n56.2" n="II" level="1"><hi rend="ital">A retirement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:38:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 38, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abductus: <entryFree id="n57" type="main" key="abductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abduco.</entryFree>
abeatae: <entryFree id="n58" type="main" key="Abea_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Abeātae</orth>, <itype>arum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n58.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Abeatoe</hi>, inhabitants of A bea in Achaia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abecedarius: <entryFree id="n59" type="main" key="a^be^ce^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĕcĕdārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>a, b, c, d</etym>, <sense id="n59.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the alphabet, alphabetical</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n59.1" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">psalmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n59.2" n="II" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n59.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĕcĕdāĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who learns the a, b, c</hi> (eccl. Lat.). —</sense><sense id="n59.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĕcĕdārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">elementary instruction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n59.5" n="C" level="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĕ-cĕdārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a, b, c, the alphabet</hi> (eccl. Lat.).</sense></entryFree>
abel: <entryFree id="n60" type="main" key="A^be_l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăbēl</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> or ēlls, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăbēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n60.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Abel, son of Adam,</hi> Vulg. —Hence, Abelĭca Virtus, Mythogr. Vatic. 3, 6, 15.</sense></entryFree>
abella: <entryFree id="n61" type="main" key="A^bella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăbella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n61.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Campania, near Nolu, abounding in fruit-trees and nuts</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Avella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:545" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 545</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 740</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abellāna</orth> <itype>nux or Avellana, also Abellina</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the filbert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abellani</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Abella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abellinum: <entryFree id="n62" type="main" key="Abelli_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Abellīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n62.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Abellinum, a city of the Hirpini, in Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abellīnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Abellinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 11, § 105</bibl>; another town of this name in Italy is referred to by Pliny, 1. 1.</sense></entryFree>
abellio: <entryFree id="n63" type="main" key="Abelli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Abellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n63.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Gallic deity</hi>, Inser. Orell. 1952 sq.</sense></entryFree>
abemito: <entryFree id="n64" type="gloss" key="a^bemi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbemĭto</orth> <itype>significat demito vel auferto</itype> (<sense id="n64.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">take away</hi>); EMERE enim antiqui dicebant pro accipere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.; cf. adimo.</sense></entryFree>
abeo: <entryFree id="n65" type="main" key="a^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭvi or ii, ītum, īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (abin= abisne, Plaut. and Ter.; abiit, dissyl., v. Herm. Doctr. Metr. p. 153), <sense id="n65.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go from</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to go away, depart</hi>. </sense><sense id="n65.1" n="I" level="1"><usg type="style">Lit.</usg>. </sense><sense id="n65.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab, ex</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, the <orth extent="full" lang="la">acc</orth>. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, the local adv. <hi rend="ital">hinc</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abeo ab illo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Cure. 2, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi in malam rem maxumam a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit> (v. infra); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abin e conspectu meo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit> (but also abin ab oculis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 140</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 24</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ablturos agro Argivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire in aliquas terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanus, qui hinc abiit modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi prae, jam ego sequar,</quote> <trans><tr>go on, I will soon follow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abiit exsulatum,</quote> <trans><tr>into exile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; Liv. <cb n="ABEQ" /> 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abi deambulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Catilina) abiit, excessit, evasit, erupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor de sellā surrexit atque abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dederat abeuntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:196 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 196 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub jugum abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>. —Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus sub altum pectus abit,</quote> <trans><tr>penetrates deeply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 700</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n65.3" n="B" level="2">In partic. </sense><sense id="n65.4" n="1" level="3"><hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>, so that no trace remains; <hi rend="ital">to disappear, vanish, cease</hi>. </sense><sense id="n65.5" n="a" level="4">Of man, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nune abierunt hinc in communem locum (i.e. in Orcum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea mortem obiit, e medio abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 30</bibl></cit>; so also Cic.: abiit e vitā, Tusc. 1, 30, 74 al. — </sense><sense id="n65.6" n="b" level="4">Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass away, elapse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec abiit hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abit dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota abit hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n65.7" n="c" level="4">Of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">per inane profundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nausea jam plane abiit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:290 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 290 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n65.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be changed from</hi> one's own ways or nature into something else, <hi rend="ital">to be transformed, metamorphosed;</hi> always constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (chiefly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, esp. in Ov. M., as a constant expression for metamorphosis): terra abit in nimbos imbremque, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 24</bibl> Mūll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in corpus corpore toto,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass with their whole body into another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut abit in somnum,</quote> <trans><tr>is, as it were, wholly dissolved in sleep, is all sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1066" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1066</bibl></cit>: E in V abiit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 91</bibl> Mūll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in villos abeunt vestes, in crura lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 236</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:674" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 674</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam barba comaeque in silvas abeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:657" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 657</bibl></cit>; 4, 396; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:398" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 398</bibl>; 8,555; 14, 499; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 551 al.: in vanum abibunt monentium verba,</quote> <trans><tr>will dissolce into nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, in avi mores regem abiturum,</quote> <trans><tr>would adopt the ways of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n65.9" n="II" level="1"><usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n65.10" n="A" level="2">In gen., <hi rend="ital">to depart from, to leave off, to turn aside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab jure non abeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab emptione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 7, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:14:section=2" default="NO">18, 2, 14, § 2</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">a venditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: sed abeo a sensibus, <hi rend="ital">leave</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">speak no more of</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 9</bibl>; so often with <hi rend="ital">longe</hi>: non longe abieris, <hi rend="ital">you need not go far</hi> to seek for examples, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne longius abeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caec. 33, 95 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ad istas ineptias abis?</quote> <trans><tr>why do you have recourse to —?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abit causa in laudes Cn. Pompeii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc, unde abii, redeo,</quote> <trans><tr>I set out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium retro abiit,</quote> <trans><tr>has fallen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n65.11" n="B" level="2">In partic. </sense><sense id="n65.12" n="1" level="3">With <hi rend="ital">abl., to retire from</hi> an office or occupation: <cit><quote lang="la">abiens magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 7</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 38</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">abire consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flaminio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:4:3:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 4, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelā vel curā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3:section=18 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 10, 3, § 18 al.</bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n65.13" n="2" level="3">Of the consequence or result of an action, <hi rend="ital">to turn out, end, terminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabar hoc si sic abiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non posse ista sic abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 16 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n65.14" n="3" level="3">In auctions, t. t., <hi rend="ital">not to be knocked down to one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res abiret ab eo mancipe,</quote> <trans><tr>should not fall to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne res abiret ab eo,</quote> <trans><tr>that he may purchase it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:205" default="NO">50, 17, 205</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n65.15" n="4" level="3">The <hi rend="ital">imper</hi>. abi is often a simple exclamation or address, either with a friendly or reproachful signif. </sense><sense id="n65.16" n="a" level="4"> Abi, Indis me, credo, <hi rend="ital">Begone, you are fooling me!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 32</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 205</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n65.17" n="b" level="4"><hi rend="ital">Begone! be off!</hi> abi modo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi, nescis inescare homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">bence in the malediction, abi in malam rem!</quote> <trans><tr>go be hanged!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abin hine in malam crucem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 163</bibl></cit> (ef. Cic.: quin tu abis in malam pestem malumque cruciatum? Phil. 13, 21); v. crux and cruciatus.</sense></entryFree>
abeona: <entryFree id="n66" type="main" key="A^be^o_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăbĕōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abeo</etym>, <sense id="n66.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of departing</hi> children, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21.</sense></entryFree>
abequito: <entryFree id="n67" type="hapax" key="a^be^qui^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ĕquĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n67.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to ride away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praetores pavidi abequitaverint Syracu sas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: v. Weissenb. ad h l. <pb n="7" /> <cb n="ABHO" /></sense></entryFree>
abercet: <entryFree id="n68" type="gloss" key="a^bercet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbercet</orth> = prohibet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 25</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
aberratio: <entryFree id="n69" type="main" key="a^berra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăberrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aberro, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n69.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a relief</hi> from something, <hi rend="ital">a diversion;</hi> perh. only in Cicero (and in him only in two passages): <cit><quote lang="la">a dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:12:38:3" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 12, 38, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. ib. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: non equidem levor, sed tamen aberro): a molestiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Fam. 15:18:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aberro: <entryFree id="n70" type="main" key="a^berro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-erro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n70.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander from the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go astray.</hi> </sense><sense id="n70.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer inter homines aberravit a patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus, qui pecore aberrāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n70.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n70.3" n="A" level="2"> (Like abeo, II. A.) <hi rend="ital">To wander from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stray</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">deviate from</hi> a purpose, subject, etc. (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">a regulā et praescriptione naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Acc. 2, 46, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ab eo, quod propositum est, longius aberret oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28 al.</bibl>—Also without <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne nihil conjecturā aberrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22</bibl></cit> (with a conjecturā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 100</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si aberrare ad alia coeperit, ad haec revocetur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo, ut artificem (sc. pictorem), quem elegeris, ne in melius quidem sinas aberrare,</quote> <trans><tr>that the painter should not depart from the original</tr>, <tr>even to improve it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n70.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To divert</hi> the mind or attention, <hi rend="ital">to forget for a time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ego hic scribendo dies totos nihil equidem levor, sed tamen aberro,</quote> <trans><tr>I am indeed not free from sorrow</tr>, <tr>but I divert my thoughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 45</bibl> (cf. aberratio).</sense></entryFree>
abfore: <entryFree id="n71" type="main" key="abfo^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abfŏre</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">abfŏrem</orth>, v. absum.</entryFree>
abgregare: <entryFree id="n72" type="gloss" key="abgre^ga_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abgrĕgāre</orth> <itype>est a grege ducere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
abhiemo: <entryFree id="n73" type="spur" key="abhi^e^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abhĭĕmo</orth>, a false read. for hiemo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 81, § 354</bibl>.</entryFree>
abhinc: <entryFree id="n74" type="main" key="a^bhinc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-hinc</orth>, <sense id="n74.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">temp. adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n74.1" n="I" level="1"> Of future time, <hi rend="ital">henceforth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter</hi> (anteclass.): seque ad ludos jam inde abhinc exerceant, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 175</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. p. 80 Rib.); so, aufer abhinc lacrimas. —But more usu., </sense><sense id="n74.2" n="II" level="1"> Of past time, <hi rend="ital">ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> or <case>abl.</case>, and the <hi rend="ital">cardin. num.</hi> (except the comic poets most freq. in Cic., both in his Orations and Letters). </sense><sense id="n74.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed abhinc annos factumst sedecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 39</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 28</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abhinc triennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abhinc annos quattuordecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 36 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n74.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui abhinc sexaginta annis occisus foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">abhinc annis xv.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiis jam abhinc diebus triginta factis,</quote> <trans><tr>thirty days ago</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:967" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 967</bibl>: aufer abhinc lacrimas, it is prob. only a fuller expression for hinc, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 19</bibl>: jurgium hinc auferas, since there is no other example where abhinc is used of <hi rend="ital">place.</hi> Vid. upon this article, Hand, Turs. 1, 63-66.</sense></entryFree>
abhorreo: <entryFree id="n75" type="main" key="a^bhorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-horrĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n75.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shrink back from</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to shudder at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abhor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n75.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (syn. aversor; rare but class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, sometimes with the <case>acc.</case> (not so in Cicero; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Haase ad Reisig Vorles. p. 696): retro volgus abhorret ab hac,</quote> <trans><tr>shrinks back from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:945" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 945</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes aspernabantur, omnes abhorrebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam abhorret hilaritudo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumilos atque distortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>; Vit. 10.</sense><sense id="n75.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n75.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be averse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disinclined to</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">not to wish</hi> it, usu. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab re uxoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so often in Cic.: Caesaris a causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a caede,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab horum turpitudine, audaciā, sordibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a scribendo abhorret animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo abhorruisse ab optimo statu civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a ceterorum consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 5 al.</bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n75.4" n="B" level="2"> In a yet more general sense, <hi rend="ital">to be remote from</hi> an object, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to vary</hi> or <hi rend="ital">differ from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be inconsistent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not to agree with</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas tanta, ut non procul abhorreat ab insaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vulgari genere orationis atque a consuetudine communis sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio abhorrens a personā hominis gravissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab opinione tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: Punicum abhorrens os ab Latinorum nominum prolatione,<cb n="ABIC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:44" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fide,</quote> <trans><tr>to be incredible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tuo scelere,</quote> <trans><tr>is not connected with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7 al.</bibl></cit> —Hence, like dispar, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam pacatae profectioni abhorrens mos,</quote> <trans><tr>not accordant with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n75.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be free from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caelius longe ab istā suspicione abhorrere debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n75.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n75.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum abhorret ac mutat,</quote> <trans><tr>alters and changes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n75.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be unfit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin plane abhorrebit et erit absurdus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">absurdae atque abhorrentes lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 44, 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen abhorrens et inconditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 37, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abhorresco: <entryFree id="n76" type="main" key="a^bhorresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-horresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, = horresco (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 12</bibl>.</entryFree>
abhorride: <entryFree id="n77" type="hapax" key="a^bhorride_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-horridē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n77.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in an unfit manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improperly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 41</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
abicio: <entryFree id="n78" type="main" key="a^bi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭcĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">abjĭc-</orth> (in the best MSS. abicio; cf. <sense id="n78.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ăbĭci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ăbĭcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 17</bibl></cit>), <itype>ĕre, jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ab-jacio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cast away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n78.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sepulcrum ejus abjecta gleba non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 23</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne regium de capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socer ad pedes abjectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se ad pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se e muro in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impelluntur, feriuntur, abiciuntur, cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se abjecit exanimatus,</quote> <trans><tr>he threw himself down as if lifeless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te uret sarcina, abicito,</quote> <trans><tr>throw it down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, when the place from which a thing is thrown is designated: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum in mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> so, ut se abiceret in herba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas in propatulo domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver in viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cadaver abjeceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n78.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n78.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cast off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum tenebris abjectis inalbabat,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as the day</tr>, <tr>having dispelled the darkness</tr>, <tr>was beginning to brighten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 219" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 219</bibl></cit> Vahl.: nusquam ego vidi abjectas aedīs, nisi modo hasce, <hi rend="ital">thrown away</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">sold too low</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 3</bibl>: psaltria aliquo abiciendast, <hi rend="ital">must be got rid off</hi> (<hi rend="ital">il faut se defaire d'elle</hi>, Dacier), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam beneficiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versum,</quote> <trans><tr>to declaim it carelessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26</bibl></cit> (cf. with <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 59</bibl>: ponendus est ille ambitus, non abiciendus, <hi rend="ital">the period must be brought gradually to a close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not broken off abruptly</hi>).</sense><sense id="n78.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n78.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast aside</hi> care for, remembrance of, etc., <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abicimus ista,</quote> <trans><tr>we let that go</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama ingenii mihi est abicienda,</quote> <trans><tr>I must renounce</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 16</bibl></cit>: domum Sullanam desperabam jam . . . sed tamen non abjeci, <hi rend="ital">but yet I have not abandoned it</hi>, i. e. its purchase, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjectis nugis,</quote> <trans><tr>nonsense apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 141</bibl></cit> (cf. amoto ludo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 27</bibl>).</sense><sense id="n78.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cast down to a lower grade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to degrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9</bibl>: hic annus senatus auctoritatem abjecit, <hi rend="ital">degraded</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lowered the authority of the Senate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18</bibl>; so also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 104</bibl>.—Hence, abjectae res, <hi rend="ital">reduced circumstances</hi> (opp. florentes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n78.7" n="3" level="3"> Abicere se, <hi rend="ital">to throw one's self away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade one's self</hi>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23</bibl>: ut enim fit, etc.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">abjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">downcast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disheartened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">désponding; low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprincipled.</hi> </sense><sense id="n78.8" n="A" level="2"> Quo me miser conferam? An domum? matremne ut miseram lamentantem videam et abjectam? Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 56, 214</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura scribere non possum, ita sum animo perculso et abjecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n78.9" n="B" level="2"> Nihil abjectum, nihil humile cogitare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptum atque abjectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis nec inops nec abjectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:222 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 222 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus abjectior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus abjectissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:13 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 13 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">abjectē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n78.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dispiritedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despondingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dolore est providendum, ne quid abjecte, ne quid timide, ne quid ignave faciamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n78.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sordidius et abjectius nati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incuriose et abjecte verbum positum,</quote> <trans><tr>improperly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>. <cb n="ABIT" /></sense></entryFree>
abiegnus: <entryFree id="n79" type="main" key="a^bi^e_gnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭēgnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, also tri. syllabic; collateral form ABIEGNEVS, Inscr. Napol.) [abies], <sense id="n79.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of fir-wood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deal</hi>: trabes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>, Enn. ap. Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the wooden horse before Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl>): stipes, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=219" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 219</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 170 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">hastile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:4 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
abiens: <entryFree id="n80" type="main" key="a^bi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭens</orth>, <itype>euntis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abeo.</entryFree>
abies: <entryFree id="n81" type="main" key="a^bi^e_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭēs</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype> (abietis, abiete, trisyllabic in <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 16 al.</bibl>; so, abietibus, quadrisyl. sometimes, as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 674</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. uncer., perh. akin to <foreign lang="greek">a)ldai/nw</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)la/th</foreign> = pinus</etym>, <sense id="n81.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the silver-fir</hi>: Pinus picea, Linn.: <foreign lang="greek">e)la/th</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the tree</hi> as well as <hi rend="ital">the wood</hi> of it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 15, 1</bibl>: abies consternitur alta, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 195 Vahl.): crispa, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 117 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">enodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10</bibl></cit>. 94. In Verg., on account of its dark foliage, called nigra: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrā abiete, A. 3, 599: abietibus patriis aequi juvenes,</quote> <trans><tr>tall as their native firs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:674" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 674</bibl></cit> (imitation of Hom. ll. 5, 560: <foreign lang="greek">e)la/th|sin e)oiko/tes u(yhlh=|sin</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n81.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, meton. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 20</bibl>), like the Greek <foreign lang="greek">e)la/th</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">any thing made of fir.</hi> </sense><sense id="n81.2" n="1" level="3"> = epistula, <hi rend="ital">a letter</hi> (written on a tablet <hi rend="ital">of fir</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 66</bibl> (cf. Engl. <hi rend="ital">book</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">beech</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n81.3" n="2" level="3"> = navis, <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 91</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 663</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n81.4" n="3" level="3"> = hasta, <hi rend="ital">a lance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 667</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abietarius: <entryFree id="n82" type="main" key="a^bi^e^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭĕtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>abies</etym>, <sense id="n82.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to fir-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deal</hi>: negotio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭĕtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a joiner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abiga: <entryFree id="n83" type="hapax" key="a^bi^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abigo</etym>, <sense id="n83.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant which has the power of producing abortion;</hi> Greek <foreign lang="greek">xamai/pitus</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">ground-pine</hi>: Teucrium iva, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 20, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abigeator: <entryFree id="n84" type="hapax" key="a^bi^ge^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭgĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = abigeus or abactor, <sense id="n84.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cattle-stealer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abigeatus: <entryFree id="n85" type="main" key="a^bi^ge^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭgĕātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>abigeus</etym>, <sense id="n85.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cattlestealing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:14:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 14, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:5:section=2" default="NO">49, 16, 5, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abigeus: <entryFree id="n86" type="main" key="a^bi^ge^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭgĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>abigo</etym>, <sense id="n86.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that drives away</hi> cattle, <hi rend="ital">a cattle-stealer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:14:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:16" default="NO">48, 19, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abigo: <entryFree id="n87" type="main" key="a^bi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>, <sense id="n87.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n87.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n87.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">abigam jam ego illum advenientem ab aedibus,</quote> <trans><tr>I will drive him away as soon as he comes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hic me abegerit suo odio,</quote> <trans><tr>he will soon drive me away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem post divortium,</quote> <trans><tr>to remove from the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n87.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n87.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drive away</hi> cattle: <cit><quote lang="la">familias abripuerunt, pecus abegerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n87.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg> </sense><sense id="n87.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To remove</hi> a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">febres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 59, § 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 30</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenatorum morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n87.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To force birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure abortion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum medicamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n87.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi> an evil, <hi rend="ital">get rid of</hi> a nuisance: pestem a me, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl> (Trag. v. 50 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinem abs te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem epulis regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 44 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n87.9" n="A" level="2"> Of magistrates, <hi rend="ital">driven away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forced to resign</hi> their office, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n87.10" n="B" level="2"> Abacta nox, i. q. finita, <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 407</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n87.11" n="C" level="2"> Abacti oculi, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunken</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:104" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abii: <entryFree id="n88" type="main" key="A^bi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăbĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n88.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian tribe in Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abitio: <entryFree id="n89" type="main" key="a^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abeo</etym>, <sense id="n89.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n89.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (ante-class. for abitus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n89.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., = mors, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, acc. to Gloss. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=380:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 380, 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
abito: <entryFree id="n90" type="hapax" key="a_bi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-bīto</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>bēto, bīto</etym>, <sense id="n90.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quo abitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. Lucil. ap. Vel. Long. p. 2225 P.</sense></entryFree>
abitus: <entryFree id="n91" type="main" key="a^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>abeo</etym>, <sense id="n91.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n91.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in abstr. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum videam miserum hunc tam excruciarier ejus abitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 457</bibl> and 677; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:311 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 311 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n91.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr., <hi rend="ital">the place through which one goes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the outlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place of egress</hi> (as aditus, <pb n="8" /> <cb n="ABLE" /> of entrance): <cit><quote lang="la">omnemque abitum custode coronant,</quote> <trans><tr>they surround the outlet with guards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 380</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumjecta vehicula sepserant abitus,</quote> <trans><tr>barricaded the passages out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abjecte: <entryFree id="n92" type="main" key="abjecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abjectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. abicio, <sense id="n92.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
abjectio: <entryFree id="n93" type="main" key="abjecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abjectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abicio</etym>. * <sense id="n93.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing away</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rejecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurarum (opp. additio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n93.1" n="II" level="1"> Abjectio animi, <hi rend="ital">dejection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despondency</hi> (joined h. l. with debilitatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abjectus: <entryFree id="n94" type="main" key="abjectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>abicio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
abjicio: <entryFree id="n95" type="main" key="abjicio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abjicio</orth>, v. abicio.</entryFree>
abjudicativus: <entryFree id="n96" type="hapax" key="abju_di^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abjūdĭcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, in later philos. lang. = negativus, <sense id="n96.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">negative</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> pp. Dogm. Plat. p. 30</bibl> Elm. (267 Oud.).</sense></entryFree>
abjudico: <entryFree id="n97" type="main" key="abju_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-jūdĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n97.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive</hi> one <hi rend="ital">of</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">by judicial sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare that</hi> it <hi rend="ital">does not belong to</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to abjudicate</hi>, lit. and trop. (opp. adjudico); constr. with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquem ab aliquo</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjudicata a me modo est Palaestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Rullus) judicabit Alexandream regis esse, a populo Romano abjudicabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem veritatis, integritatis... ab hoc ordine abjudicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 34</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 102</bibl>, many since Budaeus, acc. to the MSS., read <hi rend="ital">abdĭco;</hi> so B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
abjugo: <entryFree id="n98" type="hapax" key="abju_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-jūgo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., <sense id="n98.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to loose from the yoke;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate from</hi>: quae res te ab stabulis abjugat? Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 73, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 104 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
abjunctus: <entryFree id="n99" type="main" key="abjunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abjungo.</entryFree>
abjungo: <entryFree id="n100" type="main" key="abjungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-jungo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n100.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to unyoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 518</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n100.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to detach from</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjuncto Labieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl></cit>: Demosthenes se ab hoc refractariolo judiciali dicendi genere abjunxit, <hi rend="ital">abstained from</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abjuratio: <entryFree id="n101" type="main" key="abju_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abjūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abjuro</etym>, <sense id="n101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forswearing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 6, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abjurgo: <entryFree id="n102" type="hapax" key="abjurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-jurgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deny</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuse reproachfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 107" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abjuro: <entryFree id="n103" type="main" key="abju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-jūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (abjurassit for abjuraverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 9</bibl>), <sense id="n103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deny any thing on oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem alicui. ne quis mihi in jure abjurassit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; cf.: mihi abjurare certius est quam dependere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjuratae rapinae,</quote> <trans><tr>abjured</tr>, <tr>denied on oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ablactatio: <entryFree id="n104" type="main" key="ablacta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablactātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ablacto</etym>, <sense id="n104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the weaning of a child</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:21:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 21, 8 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ablacto: <entryFree id="n105" type="main" key="ablacto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-lacto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wean</hi> (eccl. Lat.).</sense></entryFree>
