ablaqueatio: <entryFree id="n106" type="main" key="abla^que^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablăquĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ablaqueo</etym>, <sense id="n106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loosening of the soil round the roots of a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:2" default="NO">4, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:66 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 33, § 66 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n106.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the trench itself made by digging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 17</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
ablaqueo: <entryFree id="n107" type="main" key="abla^que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-lăquĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laqueus, a hollow</etym>, <sense id="n107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn up the earth round a tree</hi>, in order to form a <hi rend="ital">trench</hi> for water, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:2" default="NO">4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 19, 31, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ablatio: <entryFree id="n108" type="main" key="abla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aufero</etym>, <sense id="n108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking away</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jovin. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ablativus: <entryFree id="n109" type="main" key="abla_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablātīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, with or without casus, <sense id="n109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ablative case</hi> (as denoting that from which something <hi rend="ital">is taken away</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:3" default="NO">1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:26" default="NO">1, 4, 26</bibl>; 7, 9, 10 al.</sense></entryFree>
ablator: <entryFree id="n110" type="main" key="abla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes away</hi> (eccl. Lat.).</sense></entryFree>
ablatus: <entryFree id="n111" type="main" key="abla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of aufero.</entryFree>
ablegatio: <entryFree id="n112" type="main" key="able_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablēgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ablego</etym>, <sense id="n112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 7</bibl></cit>.—A euphemism for <hi rend="ital">banishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi> (= relegatio): <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ablegmina: <entryFree id="n113" type="gloss" key="ablegmi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablegmĭna</orth>: partes extorum, quae diis immolantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 21</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
ablego: <entryFree id="n114" type="main" key="able_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-lēgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo mihi est hinc ablegandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus a prato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: honestos <cb n="ABNE" /> homines, <hi rend="ital">keep at a distance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: and in the pun, haec <hi rend="ital">legatio</hi> a fratris adveutu me <hi rend="ital">ablegat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this embassy sends me away from</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">prevents me from being present at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his arrival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna pars ablegati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros venatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 2</bibl></cit>.—As a euphemism for in exsilium mittere, <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; Cod. Th. 16, 5, 57.</sense></entryFree>
ablepsia: <entryFree id="n115" type="greek" key="ablepsi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablepsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)bleyi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blindness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 647</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 39</bibl> written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
abligurrio: <entryFree id="n116" type="main" key="abli^gu_rri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-lĭgūrrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-gurio</orth>), <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n116.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lick away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spend in luxurious indulgence</hi>: bona, Enn. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 25</bibl> (Sat. 29 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 313</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl>, the correct read. is <hi rend="ital">obligaverunt</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n116.1" n="II" level="1"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abligurritio: <entryFree id="n117" type="hapax" key="abli^gu_rri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablĭgūrrītĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-guri-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abligurrio</etym>, <sense id="n117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consuming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spending in feasting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abligurritor: <entryFree id="n118" type="hapax" key="abli^gu_rri_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablĭgūrrītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-guri-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who consumes in feasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spendthrift</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abloco: <entryFree id="n119" type="hapax" key="ablo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-lŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lease out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">let out on hire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abludo: <entryFree id="n120" type="hapax" key="ablu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-lūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n.;</hi> meton. (like the Greek <foreign lang="greek">a)pa/|dein</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">not to agree with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to differ from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unlike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec a te non multum abludit imago,</quote> <trans><tr>is not much unlike thee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 320</bibl></cit> (= abhorret, discrepat).</sense></entryFree>
abluo: <entryFree id="n121" type="main" key="ablu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-lŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify.</hi> </sense><sense id="n121.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pulverem lymphis, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 13</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 108 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixi pedes abluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec me flumine vivo abluero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abluendo cruori balneas petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">abluere sitim,</quote> <trans><tr>to quench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 876</bibl></cit>; and: abluere sibi umbras, <hi rend="ital">to remove darkness</hi> (by bringing a light), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 378</bibl>.—Of the washing away of earth by a shower, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35</bibl>.—In eccl. Lat., of baptism: munere divinitatis abluti, Cod. Th. 19, 6, 4.—</sense><sense id="n121.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of calming the passions: omnis ejusmodi perturbatio animi placatione abluatur, <hi rend="ital">be removed</hi> (fig. derived from the religious rite of <hi rend="ital">washing in expiation of sin</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculam veteris industriae laudabili otio,</quote> <trans><tr>to wash out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:681 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 681 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ablutio: <entryFree id="n122" type="main" key="ablu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abluo</etym>, <sense id="n122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleansing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7</bibl>.—Of baptism, cf. abluo, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (eccl. Lat.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 74</bibl>, the correct reading is <hi rend="ital">adulatione;</hi> v. Sillig ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
ablutor: <entryFree id="n123" type="hapax" key="ablu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that washes off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purifies</hi> (eccl. Lat.).</sense></entryFree>
ablutus: <entryFree id="n124" type="main" key="ablu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abluo.</entryFree>
abluvium: <entryFree id="n125" type="main" key="ablu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ablŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>abluo</etym>, = diluvium, <sense id="n125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deluge</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 1</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 300, n. 17 Rib.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=69" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 69</bibl> Goes.; cf. Isid. in Magi Auct. vi. p. 503.</sense></entryFree>
abmatertera: <entryFree id="n126" type="main" key="abma_terte^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-mātertĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great-greatgreat-aunt</hi> on the mother's side, also called matertera maxima, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abnato: <entryFree id="n127" type="hapax" key="abna^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-năto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 383</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abnegatio: <entryFree id="n128" type="main" key="abne^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abnĕgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abnego</etym>, <sense id="n128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denial</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abnegativus: <entryFree id="n129" type="main" key="abne^ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abnĕgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">negative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbium,</quote> <trans><tr>a negative adverb</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1020</bibl></cit> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
abnegator: <entryFree id="n130" type="main" key="abne^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abnĕgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denier</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abnego: <entryFree id="n131" type="main" key="abne^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unwilling</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">conjugium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 424</bibl></cit>: imbrem, Col. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) 10, 51: <cit><quote lang="la">comitem (se),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:110" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">depositum,</quote> <trans><tr>to deny</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">partem pecuniae (pactae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:11 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 11 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicas adhibere manus ad vulnera pastor Abnegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 456</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 637</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abnegat, inceptoque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 654</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abnepos: <entryFree id="n132" type="main" key="abne^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nĕpos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of a greatgrandchild</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=15 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
abneptis: <entryFree id="n133" type="main" key="abneptis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-neptis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of a</hi> <cb n="ABNU" /> <hi rend="ital">great-grandchild</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38</bibl> 10, 10, § 15 al.</sense></entryFree>
abnoba: <entryFree id="n134" type="main" key="Abno^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Abnŏba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain range in Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the northern part of the Black Forest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which the Danube rises</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl>; cf. Mannert, Germ. p. 512.—</sense><sense id="n134.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abnŏba Diana</orth>, or simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abnŏba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of this mountain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1986</bibl> and 4974.</sense></entryFree>
abnocto: <entryFree id="n135" type="main" key="abnocto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nocto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>nox</etym>, <sense id="n135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pass the night abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stay out all night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abnodo: <entryFree id="n136" type="main" key="abno_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nōdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off knots;</hi> in the lang. of gardening and the vintage, <hi rend="ital">to clear</hi> trees <hi rend="ital">of knots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:4" default="NO">4, 22, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abnormis: <entryFree id="n137" type="hapax" key="abnormis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-normis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>norma, v. ab, III. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deviating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">departing from a fixed rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abnormal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abnormis sapiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit> (i. e. qui in nullius verba juravit, <hi rend="ital">belongs to no distinct sect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">party</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl>: ad istorum normam sapientes).</sense></entryFree>
abnueo: <entryFree id="n138" type="main" key="abnu^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nŭĕo</orth>, v. abnuo.</entryFree>
abnuitio: <entryFree id="n139" type="hapax" key="abnu^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abnŭĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abnuo</etym>, = negatio, <sense id="n139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">negation</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
abnuiturus: <entryFree id="n140" type="main" key="abnu^i^tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abnŭĭtūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = abnuturus, v. abnuo.</entryFree>
abnumero: <entryFree id="n141" type="hapax" key="abnu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast up numbers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reckon up</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abnuo: <entryFree id="n142" type="main" key="abnu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ŭĭtum</itype> (hence abnŭĭturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. 1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Fragm. 1, 37</bibl> Kritz), or <itype>ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (abnueo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl> P. or Ann. v. 283 Vahl.: <sense id="n142.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">abnuebunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> or Trag. v. 371 id.), lit., <hi rend="ital">to refuse by a nod</hi> (cf. Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>); hence, <hi rend="ital">to deny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to decline</hi> doing a thing, <hi rend="ital">to reject.</hi> </sense><sense id="n142.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n142.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (syn. recuso; opp. concedo), constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with the <case>acc.</case>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">de.</hi> </sense><sense id="n142.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recuso, non abnuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 36, 100</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n142.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (in Cic. only with general objects, as quid, nihil): <cit><quote lang="la">cum intellegas, quid quisque concedat, quid abnuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil umquam abnuit meo studio voluntas tua,</quote> <trans><tr>refused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui: regi pacem neque abnuere neque pollicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia (opp. probo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 83</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abnuere cognomen Bruti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:66:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 66, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium auspiciumque,</quote> <trans><tr>to reject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regulae rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem comitem inceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:110" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 110</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n142.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare abnueo, Enn. l. l.: nec abnuebant melioribus parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 37, 4</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternam sibi naturam abnuit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 641</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abnueret a se commissum esse facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">haud equidem abnuo egregium ducem fuisse Alexandrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:11" default="NO">6, 2, 11</bibl> (opp. concedo); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 8 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: manu abnuit quidquam opis in se esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 34, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec abnuitur ita fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72, 6</bibl></cit>. —*</sense><sense id="n142.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non abnuere se quin cuncta mala patefierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl></cit>.— * (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi senatus de ullo negotio abnuere audebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n142.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp., abnuens, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)peipw/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">declining</hi> service, <hi rend="ital">giving up</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">milites fessos itineris magnitudine et jam abnuentes omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fessos abnuentesque taedio et labore,</quote> <trans><tr>declining the combat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 49, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n142.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract subjects, <hi rend="ital">not to admit of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be unfavorable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quod spes abnuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando impetus et subita belli locus abnueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc videretur, nisi abnueret duritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abnutivus: <entryFree id="n143" type="main" key="abnu_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abnūtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>abnuo</etym>, = negativus; hence <sense id="n143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">abnūtīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a denying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:83" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 83</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">Abnutivum</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a)pwmotiko/n</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
abnuto: <entryFree id="n144" type="main" key="abnu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-nūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to deny</hi> (<hi rend="ital">by a nod</hi>) <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refuse</hi>: quid te adiri (Vahl. adirier; Rib. adiri tam) abnutas, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 164</bibl> (where Cic. censures the word as less forcible than <hi rend="ital">vetas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prohibes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absterres</hi>, and the like): <pb n="9" /> <cb n="ABOM" /> quid mi abnutas? Tibi ego abnuto? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abolefacio: <entryFree id="n145" type="hapax" key="a^bo^le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ŏlĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, = aboleo, <sense id="n145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl></cit> (al. <hi rend="ital">obolefacere</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
aboleo: <entryFree id="n146" type="main" key="a^bo^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ēvi</itype> (ui), <itype>ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, orig. (in contrast with ad-oleo) <sense id="n146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to retard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to check the growth of;</hi> hence, in a more extended sense, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolish;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to terminate</hi>, and, in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to decay</hi> (not before the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n146.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta viri monumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum aedes vetustate aut igni abolitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus alicujus igni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to burn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homeri carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 34 al.</bibl></cit>— In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: aboleri, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi> (opp. nasci), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl>, prooem. § 4.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera undis,</quote> <trans><tr>to remove the poisonous flesh by washing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 560</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n146.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 789</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labem prioris ignominiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 720</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem (= abrogare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">decretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Galb. 23: crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:6:2:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 6, 2, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim moremque asylorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulla ex antiquis caerimoniis paulatim abolita (= omissa, neglecta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria nondum omnino abolita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abolesco: <entryFree id="n147" type="main" key="a^bo^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ŏlesco</orth>, <itype>ēvi</itype>, no <sense id="n147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> (vox Vergiliana) [aboleo], <hi rend="ital">to decay little by little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi> (like aboleo, not before the Aug. period): tantique abolescet gratia facti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 232</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec cum re nomen quoque vetustate abolevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rei prope jam memoria aboleverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 55, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abolescit, Crescite, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exh. Cast. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abolitio: <entryFree id="n148" type="main" key="a^bo^li^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbŏlĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abrogating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annulling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolition</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n148.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tributorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quadragesimae quinquagesimaeque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n148.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n148.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An amnesty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pacto abolitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n148.4" n="B" level="2"> In the Dig., <hi rend="ital">the withdrawal of an accusation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspension</hi>: abolitio publica, ex lege, privata, Cod. Th. 9, 37, 3 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16 al.</bibl>; cf. Rein, Criminalrecht. p. 273 sq.</sense></entryFree>
abolitor: <entryFree id="n149" type="main" key="a^bo^li^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ŏlĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes away</hi> a thing, or <hi rend="ital">casts</hi> it <hi rend="ital">into oblivion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors, somnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abolla: <entryFree id="n150" type="main" key="a^bolla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbolla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)mbolh/ = a)nabolh/</foreign>, prop. a throwing back and around</etym>, <sense id="n150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robe of thick woollen stuff</hi> worn by soldiers, philosophers, etc. (called in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 421</bibl>, duplex amictus; v. Serv. ad h.l.): toga detracta est et abolla data, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>.—Of philosophers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:48" default="NO">8, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:76 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 76 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus majoris abollae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a crime committed by a deep philosopher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:115" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aboloes: <entryFree id="n151" type="gloss" key="aboloes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aboloes</orth>, for ab illis; antiqui enim litteram non geminabant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 19</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
abominabilis: <entryFree id="n152" type="main" key="a^bo_mi^na_bi^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnābĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>abominor</etym>, <sense id="n152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deserving imprecation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abhorrence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>, Quint. Decl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abominamentum: <entryFree id="n153" type="hapax" key="a^bo_mi^na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a detestable thing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abominandus: <entryFree id="n154" type="main" key="a^bo_mi^nandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnandus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnanter</orth>, v. abominor <sense id="n154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
abominatio: <entryFree id="n155" type="main" key="a^bo_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abominor</etym>, <sense id="n155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abominating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an abomination</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also = abominamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abomino: <entryFree id="n156" type="main" key="a^bo_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n156.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
abominor: <entryFree id="n157" type="main" key="a^bo_mi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ōmĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprecate</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">as an ill omen</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n157.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cum dixisset sepulcrum dirutum proram spectare, abominatus, etc., <hi rend="ital">when he had spoken the words</hi> “<hi rend="ital">a ruined sepulchre</hi>,” etc., <hi rend="ital">wishing that this</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the sepulchre</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the words spoken</hi>) <hi rend="ital">might not be of evil omen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 46</bibl>.—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">quod abominor,</quote> <trans><tr>which may God avert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 677</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:22:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 22, 7 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec universa habere abominabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n157.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. (opp. to opto), <hi rend="ital">to abominate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abhor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 33</bibl>.—Hence derivv., </sense><sense id="n157.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnan-ter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">abominably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestably</hi>, Cod. <cb n="ABRA" /> Th. 3, 12, 13.—</sense><sense id="n157.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:80" default="NO">9, 2, 80</bibl>.!*? </sense><sense id="n157.5" n="1" level="3"> Collat. <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭno</orth>, are: <cit><quote lang="la">multam abomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n157.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbōmĭnor</orth> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: saevitia eorum abominaretur ab omnibus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.—So <mood>Part.</mood>: abominatus, <hi rend="ital">abominated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accursed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semimares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubo funebris et maxime abominatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abominosus: <entryFree id="n158" type="main" key="a^bo_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ōmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = ominosus, <sense id="n158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of ill omens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portentous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Februarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 472</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
aborigines: <entryFree id="n159" type="main" key="A^bo^ri_gi^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăbŏrīgĭnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ab-origo</etym>, <sense id="n159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the primeval Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Aborigines</hi>, the nation which, previous to historical record, descended from the Apennines, and, advancing from Carseoli and Reate into the plain, drove out the Siculi; <hi rend="ital">the ancestors of the Romans</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 53</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n159.1" n="I" level="1"> Used as an appellative, <hi rend="ital">original inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 36, § 120</bibl>: Indigenae sunt inde ... geniti, quos vocant <hi rend="ital">aborigines</hi> Latini, Graeci <foreign lang="greek">au)to/xqonas</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 328</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n159.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbŏrīgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">aboriginal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2425" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2425</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
aborior: <entryFree id="n160" type="main" key="a^bo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>ortus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. dep.</hi> </sense><sense id="n160.1" n="I" level="1"> (Opp. of orior.) <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">infimus aër, ubi omnia oriuntur, ubi aboriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L.L. 5:7:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.L. 5, 7, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll. —Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">to fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infringi linguam vocemque aboriri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 155</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n160.2" n="II" level="1"> Of untimely birth, <hi rend="ital">to miscarry</hi> (v. ab, III. 1.); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 71, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aboriscor: <entryFree id="n161" type="hapax" key="a^bo^riscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăb-ŏriscor</orth>, <itype>ci</itype>, <sense id="n161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> = aborior (after the analogy of nanciscor, proficiscor), <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 732</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad h.l.</sense></entryFree>
aborsus: <entryFree id="n162" type="hapax" key="a^borsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăborsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>aborior, in the sense of misbirth</etym>, <sense id="n162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has brought forth prematurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aborsus abactus venter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n163" type="main" key="a^borsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăborsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = abortus, <sense id="n163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">miscarriage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Fig. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 448, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abortio: <entryFree id="n164" type="main" key="a^borti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbortĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">premature delivery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miscarriage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:38:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 38, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n165" type="main" key="a^borti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbortĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> <sense id="n165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to miscarry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 21, 10</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:51:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">aboriendi</hi> is the true reading (Jan.).</sense></entryFree>
abortium: <entryFree id="n166" type="hapax" key="a^borti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbortĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = abortio (eccl. Lat.).</entryFree>
abortivus: <entryFree id="n167" type="main" key="a^borti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbortīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>abortio</etym>, <sense id="n167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a premature delivery.</hi> </sense><sense id="n167.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n167.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Born prematurely</hi> = abortus: Sisyphus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 46</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum,</quote> <trans><tr>addled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:93" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n167.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That causes abortion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 226</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 5, 11, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternuisse a coitu abortivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n167.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbortīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n167.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An abortion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 8</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n167.6" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. medicamentum.) <hi rend="ital">A means of procuring abortion</hi> = abiga, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:368" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 368</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aborto: <entryFree id="n168" type="main" key="a^borto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăborto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>aborior</etym>, <sense id="n168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring forth prematurely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Firm. 3, 7, 6: filios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:6:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
abortum: <entryFree id="n169" type="main" key="abortum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abortum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n169.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
abortus: <entryFree id="n170" type="main" key="a^bortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăbortus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">abortum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 30</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 29</bibl> Müll.) [aborior], <sense id="n170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abortion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miscarriage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n170.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam abortum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tertullae nollem abortum,</quote> <trans><tr>had not miscarried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abortum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer abortion</tr>, <tr>miscarry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; but also, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause abortion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:116 al" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18, 69, § 116 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n170.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 2, 6, § 13</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n170.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of writings, <hi rend="ital">an unfinished piece</hi>, Plin. praef. § 28.</sense></entryFree>
abpatruus: <entryFree id="n171" type="main" key="abpa^tru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-pătrŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great-greatgrand-uncle</hi> on the father's side; also called <hi rend="ital">patruus maximus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:3 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
abrado: <entryFree id="n172" type="main" key="abra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-rādo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scratch off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, to <hi rend="ital">scrape away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rub off;</hi> of the beard, <hi rend="ital">to shave.</hi> </sense><sense id="n172.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus quidquam abradere membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1103</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia penitus abrasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam in superiore labro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 162</bibl></cit>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">partes radicum,</quote> <trans><tr>to grub up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrasae fauces,</quote> <trans><tr>made rough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 115</bibl></cit>: abrasa corpora, <hi rend="ital">peeled off</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)posu/rmata</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 215" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 215</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n172.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="ABRO" /> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">snatch away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil a Caecinā litium terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid bohis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 37, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abraham: <entryFree id="n173" type="main" key="A_bra^ham"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ābrăham</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ābram</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> or <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Abraham</hi> (eccl. Lat.).—</sense><sense id="n173.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence derivv. </sense><sense id="n173.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abrāhămĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant of Abraham</hi> (eccl. Lat.).—</sense><sense id="n173.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abrāhămēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Abrāmēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Abraham</hi> (eccl. Lat.).</sense></entryFree>
abrasus: <entryFree id="n174" type="main" key="abra_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abrāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abrado.</entryFree>
abrelictus: <entryFree id="n175" type="hapax" key="abre^lictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abrĕlictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = derelictus, <sense id="n175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abrenuntio: <entryFree id="n176" type="main" key="abre^nunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-rĕnuntĭo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi>, strengthened form of renuntio, <hi rend="ital">to renounce</hi>, e. g. diabolo, in baptism (eccl. Lat.).</sense></entryFree>
abreptus: <entryFree id="n177" type="main" key="abreptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abreptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abripio.</entryFree>
abripio: <entryFree id="n178" type="main" key="abri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-rĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>pui, eptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take away by violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drag away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (stronger than its synn. abduco, abigo, abstraho). </sense><sense id="n178.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n178.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">abripite hunc intro actutum inter manus,</quote> <trans><tr>hurry him away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella ex Atticā hinc abrepta,</quote> <trans><tr>stolen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abreptam ex eo loco virginem secum asportāsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de convivio in vincla atque in tenebras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">24: ab complexu alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites vi fluminis abrepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 33, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad humanum exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; with <case>acc.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">Cererem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: abripere se, <hi rend="ital">to run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scamper away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita abripuit repente sese subito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n178.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of property, <hi rend="ital">to dissipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille compersit miser, id illa univorsum abripiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n178.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente te quasi quidam aestus ingenii tui procul a terrā abripuit atque in altum ... abstraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 145</bibl></cit>: voluntate omnes tecum fuerunt; <cit><quote lang="la">tempestate abreptus est unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 34</bibl></cit> (the figure taken from those driven away in a storm at sea); so, <cit><quote lang="la">abreptus amore caedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:229" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 229</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 332</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(filium) etiam si natura a parentis similitudine abriperet,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>made unlike him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abrodiaetus: <entryFree id="n179" type="greek" key="abro^di^aetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abrŏdĭaetus</orth> (or better, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hab-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(brodi/aitos</foreign> (living delicately), <sense id="n179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of the painter Parrhasius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abrodo: <entryFree id="n180" type="main" key="abro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-rōdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gnaw off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 62, 82, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:82" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 6, 21, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abrogatio: <entryFree id="n181" type="main" key="abro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abrŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abrogo</etym>, <sense id="n181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a formal repeal of a law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abrogo: <entryFree id="n182" type="main" key="abro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n182.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, polit. t. t.: <hi rend="ital">to annul in all its parts</hi> a law now in force, <hi rend="ital">to repeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abrogate wholly</hi> (whereas <hi rend="ital">derogo</hi> means to abrogate partly and <hi rend="ital">abrogo</hi> to counteract; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">these verbs</ref></xr>), = <foreign lang="greek">a)pokuro/w</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogando legem tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Diff. 2195" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Diff. 2195</bibl></cit> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. rogo (very freq. in Cic.): huic legi nec obrogari fas est, neque derogari ex hac aliquid licet, neque tota abrogari potest,</quote> <trans><tr>this law cannot be invalidated by an opposing one</tr>, <tr>nor modified by restrictions</tr>, <tr>nor wholly repealed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 22</bibl></cit>, from which example (cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 23, 2</bibl>, and many others in Liv.) it is evident that abrogare was constr. in the classical period with <case>acc.</case>, and not, as later, with <hi rend="ital">dat.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34</bibl> Drak.—</sense><sense id="n182.1" n="B" level="2"> Of a civil office: magistratum alicui, <hi rend="ital">to take it from one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recall it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi magistratum abrogāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 83</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato legem promulgavit de imperio Lentulo abrogando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit> (so the correct read., not <hi rend="ital">Lentuli</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n182.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male fidem servando illis quoque abrogant fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>deprive others of credit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11</bibl>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abrosus: <entryFree id="n183" type="main" key="abro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abrodo.</entryFree>
abrotonites: <entryFree id="n184" type="greek" key="abro^to^ni_te_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abrŏtŏnītēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>abrotonum</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(brotoni/ths</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>; <sense id="n184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine prepared with southernwood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abrotonum: <entryFree id="n185" type="greek" key="abro^to^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abrŏtŏnum</orth> (or better, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hab-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">abrŏtŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(bro/tonon</foreign>, <sense id="n185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of a pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aromatic smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">southernwood;</hi><pb n="10" /> <cb n="ABSC" />  perh. Artemisia abrotonum, Linn.: <cit><quote lang="la">abrotoni graves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 125</bibl></cit>; so <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravem serpentibus urunt abrotonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:921" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 921</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrotonum aegro non audet dare (as a medicine),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 34</bibl>, §§ 60 and 160; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 7 sq" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 7 sq.</bibl>, 167.</sense></entryFree>
abrumpo: <entryFree id="n186" type="main" key="abrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-rumpo</orth>, <itype>ūpi, uptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break off</hi> something violently, <hi rend="ital">to rend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sever</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; seldom used before the Aug. per., only once in Cic., but afterw. by Verg., Ov., and the histt. often). </sense><sense id="n186.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vincla abrupit equus (transl. of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">desmo\n a)porrh/cas</foreign>, Il. 6, 507), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 509 Vahl.); so, nec Lethaea valet Theseus abrumpere caro vincula Pirithoo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 27</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrupti nubibus ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>torn from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 214</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with the fig. reversed, in Verg.: ingeminant abruptis nubibus ignes, A. 3, 199: abrupto sidere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hidden by clouds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 12:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs velut abrupta a cetero populo,</quote> <trans><tr>broken off</tr>, <tr>torn from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n186.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(legio Martia) se prima latrocinio Antonii abrupit,</quote> <trans><tr>first freed itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrumpere vitam,</quote> <trans><tr>to break the thread of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 579</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 497</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so later, abrumpere fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 893" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 893</bibl></cit>, or, medios annos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 610</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrumpere vitam a civitate,</quote> <trans><tr>to leave it</tr>, <tr>in order to live elsewhere</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>, <tr>violate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium sermonem,</quote> <trans><tr>to break off</tr>, <tr>interrupt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 388</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">abruptus: omnibus inter victoriam mortemve abruptis,</quote> <trans><tr>since all means of escape</tr>, <tr>except victory or death</tr>, <tr>were taken from us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-ruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">broken off from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi>, esp. of places, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">difficult of access.</hi> </sense><sense id="n186.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of places, <hi rend="ital">precipitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps, abscissus): locus in pedum mille altitudinem abruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Roma) munita abruptis montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petra undique abscissa et abrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">abruptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a steep ascent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">descent;</hi> cf. praeceps: <cit><quote lang="la">vastos sorbet in abruptum fluctus,</quote> <trans><tr>she swallows down her gulf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 422</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n186.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustiana brevitas et abruptum sermonis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumacia,</quote> <trans><tr>stubborn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv.
