Marc. 1, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 39, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per abrupta,</quote> <trans><tr>by rough</tr>, <tr>dangerous ways</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. supra: abrupta contumacia).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">abruptē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n186.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in broken manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palantes flammarum ardores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n186.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of conduct, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderately</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of discourse,</quote> <trans><tr>abruptly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:79" default="NO">4, 1, 79</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>simply</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abrupte: <entryFree id="n187" type="main" key="abrupte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abruptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. abrumpo, <sense id="n187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
abruptio: <entryFree id="n188" type="main" key="abrupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abruptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abrumpo</etym>, <sense id="n188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tearing off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rending asunder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n188.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: corrigiae, <hi rend="ital">of a shoe-latchet</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n188.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: augurii, <hi rend="ital">interruption</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 270 and 271 Müll. —Of divorce, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abruptus: <entryFree id="n189" type="main" key="abruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>abrumpo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
abs: <entryFree id="n190" type="main" key="abs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs</orth>. <pos>prep.</pos>, v. ab.</entryFree>
abscedo: <entryFree id="n191" type="main" key="absce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (sync. abscēssem = abscessissem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:109" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 109</bibl>), <sense id="n191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n191.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n191.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">abscede hinc, sis, sycophanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo e conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam senator a curiā abscessit aut populus e foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a corpore (mortui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut abscesserit inde (i. e. e castris) dictator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum navis longe in altum abscesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 66</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n191.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n191.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to march off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non prius Thebani Spartā abscessissent quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius ab urbe hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a moenibus Alexandriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si urgemus obsessos, si non ante abscedimus quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscedi ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 33, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ante abscessum est quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a moenibus abscessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus aequis abscessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n191.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To disappear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be lost from view</hi>: cor (est) in extis: jam abscedet, simul ac, etc., <hi rend="ital">will disappear</hi>, Civ. Div. <cb n="ABSC" /> 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallada abscessisse mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>has withdrawn from me</tr>, <tr>from my power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 375</bibl></cit>.—Of stars, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:72 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 72 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n191.6" n="3" level="3"> Of localities, <hi rend="ital">to retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum mare abscedebat,</quote> <trans><tr>retired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in architecture: frontis et laterum abscedentium adumbratio,</quote> <trans><tr>of the sides in the background</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl>, praef. 11.</sense><sense id="n191.7" n="4" level="3"> With respect to the result, <hi rend="ital">to retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscedere latere tecto,</quote> <trans><tr>to escape with a whole skin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n191.8" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">to leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desist from</hi>, constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: labor ille a vobis cito recedet, benefactum a vobis non abscedet (followed by abibit), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cito ab eo haec ira abscedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.— With <case>abl.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">haec te abscedat suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscedere irrito incepto,</quote> <trans><tr>to desist from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:20:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 20, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudo abscesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:307" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille abscessit (sc. petitione sua),</quote> <trans><tr>desisted from the action</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid abscederet (sc. de hereditate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">semper abscedente usufructu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abscessio: <entryFree id="n192" type="main" key="abscessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abscedo</etym>, <sense id="n192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a separating</hi>: cum ad corpora tum accessio fieret, tum abscessio, i.e. <hi rend="ital">diminution</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> B. Tr. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abscessus: <entryFree id="n193" type="main" key="abscessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absence</hi>: solis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus,</quote> <trans><tr>continued absence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 38</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n193.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an abscess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 7</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abscido: <entryFree id="n194" type="main" key="absci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-cīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi> with a sharp instrument (diff. from <hi rend="ital">ab-scindo</hi>, to break or tear off as with the hand); the former corresponds to <hi rend="ital">praecidere</hi>, the latter to <hi rend="ital">avellere</hi>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34, 4</bibl> Drak. </sense><sense id="n194.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:511 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 511 al.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:473" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncos arborum et ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n194.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of; to detract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 30, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 45, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum respectum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 85</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (orationum) alteram non libebat mihi scribere, quia abscideram,</quote> <trans><tr>had broken off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">abscīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">cut off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n194.3" n="A" level="2"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitous</hi> (cf. abruptus): <cit><quote lang="la">saxum undique abscisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 25, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n194.4" n="B" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">abrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in voce aut omnino suppressā, aut etiam abscisā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:118" default="NO">9, 4, 118</bibl> Halm (al. abscissa): <cit><quote lang="la">asperum et abscisum castigationis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefractior atque abscisior justitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>, ext. 4.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> prob. not used.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">abscīsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">cut off;</hi> hence, of speech, <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7</bibl>, ext. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:5:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 5, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abscindo: <entryFree id="n195" type="main" key="abscindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-scindo</orth>, <itype>cĭdi, cissum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rend away</hi> (v. preced. art.). </sense><sense id="n195.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam a pectore abscidit,</quote> <trans><tr>he tore the tunic down from his breast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicibus fractis caput abscidit,</quote> <trans><tr>cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeris abscindere vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 685</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam deus abscidit terras,</quote> <trans><tr>torn asunder</tr>, <tr>separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 22 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas,</quote> <trans><tr>to open the veins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n195.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">reditus dulces,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane soldo,</quote> <trans><tr>to separate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelas alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:160" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:9:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 9, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abscise: <entryFree id="n196" type="main" key="absci_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. abscido, <sense id="n196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
abscissio: <entryFree id="n197" type="hapax" key="abscissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abscindo</etym>, <sense id="n197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking off</hi> in the midst of a discourse; rhet. fig., Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 100" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abscissus: <entryFree id="n198" type="main" key="abscissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abscindo.</entryFree>
abscisus: <entryFree id="n199" type="main" key="absci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. abscido. <cb n="ABSI" /></entryFree>
abscondite: <entryFree id="n200" type="main" key="abscondi^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscondĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>abscondo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
absconditor: <entryFree id="n201" type="main" key="abscondi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abscondĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>abscondo</etym>, <sense id="n201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that hides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conceals</hi>, Jul. Firm. 5, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abscondo: <entryFree id="n202" type="main" key="abscondo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-condo</orth>, <itype>condi and condĭdi, condĭtum and consum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (abscondi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9</bibl>; Caecil. and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 75, 25</bibl>: <sense id="n202.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">abscondidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:192" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 192</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">absconsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 17:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 17, 15</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secrete</hi> (the access. idea of a careful concealment distinguishes this word from its synn. abdo, celo, abstrudo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n202.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quiddam, quod occultatur, quod quo studiosius ab istis opprimitur et absconditur, eo magis eminet et apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam (eam) abdidi, abscondidi, abstrusam habebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: aurum secundum aram, Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 890</bibl> P.: fontes absconditi, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem in vulnere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 721" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 721</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lateri abdidit ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 553</bibl></cit>; v. abdo, II. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">abscondit in aëre telum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shot it out of sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:316" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 316</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, of stars, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>, and thus become invisible, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 221</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n202.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make invisible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvium et campos caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:522" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 522</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n202.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put a place out of sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lose sight of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depart from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërias Phaeacum abscondimus arces,</quote> <trans><tr>we leave behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 291</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 154</bibl>: transmittunt cursu campos).—</sense><sense id="n202.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam furto,</quote> <trans><tr>to conceal flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 337</bibl></cit>: praenavigavimus vitam, et quemadmodum in mari, sic in hoc cursu rapidissimi temporis, primum pueritiam abscondimus, deinde adulescentiam, <hi rend="ital">leave behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlive</hi> (cf. the prec., C.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">abscondĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladii absconditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam absconditis insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus pontificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:54:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 54, 138</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n202.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">abscondĭtē</orth>, of discourse. </sense><sense id="n202.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Obscurely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstrusely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n202.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Profoundly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n202.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">absconsē</orth> (from absconsus), <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 184" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 184</bibl>; Firm. Math. 2, 2.</sense></entryFree>
absegmen: <entryFree id="n203" type="gloss" key="absegmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absegmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ab-seco</etym>, according to Festus, s. v. penitam, ap. Naev., <sense id="n203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece</hi> (of flesh) <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242, 6</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
absens: <entryFree id="n204" type="main" key="absens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (not apsens), <mood>Part.</mood> of absum.</entryFree>
absentia: <entryFree id="n205" type="main" key="absenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>absum</etym>, <sense id="n205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confer absentiam tuam cum meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 16, 37</bibl></cit>; Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 64 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimoniorum,</quote> <trans><tr>want of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
absentivus: <entryFree id="n206" type="hapax" key="absenti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absentīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>absens</etym>. <sense id="n206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long absent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:33" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absento: <entryFree id="n207" type="main" key="absento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absento</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi> one <hi rend="ital">to be absent</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to send away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriis procul absentaverit astris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Pros. 3, 213</bibl></cit> (others read amandaverit, or patriisque procul mandaverit), Cod. Th. 12, 1, 48.—</sense><sense id="n207.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be absent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentans Ulixes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> 9, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
absida: <entryFree id="n208" type="main" key="absi_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. absis <sense id="n208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
absidatus: <entryFree id="n209" type="main" key="absi_da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absīdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>absis</etym>, <sense id="n209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having an arch; arched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaulted</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Vict. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
absilio: <entryFree id="n210" type="main" key="absi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ii and ui</itype>, no <sense id="n210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [salio], <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leap off</hi>: procul, Luer. 6, 1217.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi> (as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">feu/gein ti</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">nidos tepentes absiliunt (aves),</quote> <trans><tr>fly from their warm nests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:97" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
absimilis: <entryFree id="n211" type="main" key="absi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ab, priv.</etym>, <sense id="n211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlike</hi>, usually with a <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi> and <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n211.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces non absimili formā muralium falcium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n211.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(herba) neque absimilis bitumini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
absinthiatus: <entryFree id="n212" type="main" key="absinthi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absinthĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>absinthium</etym>, <sense id="n212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing wormwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>filled with wormwood - wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6, p. 40" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, p. 40</bibl></cit> Bip.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">absinthĭā-tum</orth>, sc. vinum, <hi rend="ital">wormwood-wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Hel. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absinthites: <entryFree id="n213" type="greek" key="absinthi_te_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absinthītēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)yinqi/ths</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wormwood-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absinthium: <entryFree id="n214" type="greek" key="absinthi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absinthĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">absinthĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, ap. Varr. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 190, 25</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">a)yi/nqion</foreign>,<pb n="11" /> <cb n="ABSO" />  <sense id="n214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wormwood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:7:28 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 936</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 400</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg> for something bitter, but wholesome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absis: <entryFree id="n215" type="greek" key="absis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">apsis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Ep. 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 8, 7</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(yi/s</foreign>, lit. <sense id="n215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fitting together</hi> in a circular form, hence <hi rend="ital">an arch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vault.</hi> </sense><sense id="n215.1" n="I" level="1"> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 17</bibl>, the correct read. is aspidem, v. Sillig ad h. l.). —In a church, <hi rend="ital">the choir</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 18, 7</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Ep. 12</bibl> (in both of which it is doubtful whether absis, idis, or absida, ae, should be read; cf. Areval upon Isid. l. c.). —</sense><sense id="n215.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The circle which a star describes in its orbit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 13, § 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n215.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A round dish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bowl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Fragm. 32:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. 32, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absisto: <entryFree id="n216" type="main" key="absisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti</itype>, no <sense id="n216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (like all the compounds of the simple active verb, used only in a neutr. signif.), <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depart from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go away;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, or the <hi rend="ital">simple abl.</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n216.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me hic reliquit atque abstitit,</quote> <trans><tr>who has left me behind here</tr>, <tr>and gone off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; v. Gron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles abstitit,</quote> <trans><tr>went away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ore scintillae absistunt,</quote> <trans><tr>burst forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 259</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n216.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> with <case>abl.</case> (of subst. or gerund.) or the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to desist from</hi> an act, purpose, etc., <hi rend="ital">to cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leave off</hi> (so, perh., first in the Aug. period, for the more common <hi rend="ital">desisto</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuando magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratis benefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absiste viribus indubitare tuis,</quote> <trans><tr>cease to distrust thy strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 403</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">morari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 676</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
absitus: <entryFree id="n217" type="hapax" key="absi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 13, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absocer: <entryFree id="n218" type="hapax" key="abso^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sŏcer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great - greatgrandfather of the husband</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wife</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absolute: <entryFree id="n219" type="main" key="abso^lu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏlūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>absolvo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
absolutio: <entryFree id="n220" type="main" key="abso^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>absolvo</etym>. <sense id="n220.0" n="I" level="1"> In judicial lang., <hi rend="ital">an absolving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquittal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiis decem et sex absolutio confici poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus decimus post virginum absolutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: majestatis (for de majestate), <hi rend="ital">an acquittal from</hi> crimen majestatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11</bibl>.—In Suet. in <number>plur.</number>: reis absolutiones venditare, Vesp. 16.—</sense><sense id="n220.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Completion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consummation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n220.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus quae rationis absolutio definitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc absolutionem perfectionemque in oratore desiderans,</quote> <trans><tr>this finish and perfection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 130</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n220.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">completeness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:22:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 22, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absolutorius: <entryFree id="n221" type="main" key="abso^lu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏlūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to acquittal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release.</hi> </sense><sense id="n221.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae, damnatoria et absolutoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia, Gai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:114" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n221.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏlūtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. remedium), <hi rend="ital">a means of deliverance from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
absolutus: <entryFree id="n222" type="main" key="abso^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from</entryFree>
absolvo: <entryFree id="n223" type="main" key="absolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-solvo</orth>, <itype>vi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to loosen from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untie</hi> (usu. trop., the fig. being derived from fetters, qs. a vinculis solvere, like vinculis exsolvere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 4, 10</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n223.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">canem ante tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nodo cervicis absolutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 231: <cit><quote lang="la">valvas stabuli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 108 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absoluta lingua (ranarum) a gutture,</quote> <trans><tr>loosed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 172</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n223.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n223.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To release from a long story</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let one off quickly</hi>: Paucis absolvit, ne moraret diutius, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 395</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. p. 98 Rib.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">te absolvam brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n223.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dismiss by paying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pay off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absolve hunc vomitum ... quattuor quadraginta illi debentur minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 120</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 13</bibl> and 18.—Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to dismiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to release</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hosce absolutos censeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ironic.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n223.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To free from</hi> (Ciceronian): ut nec Roscium stipulatione alliget, neque a Fannio judicio se absolvat, <hi rend="ital">extricate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free</hi> <cb n="ABSO" /> <hi rend="ital">himself from a lawsuit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: caede hostis se absolvere, <hi rend="ital">to absolve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear one's self by murdering an enemy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 31</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; hence,</sense><sense id="n223.6" n="D" level="2"> In judicial lang., t. t., <hi rend="ital">to absolve from</hi> a charge, <hi rend="ital">to acquit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare innocent;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">de</hi> (Zumpt, § 446; <cit><quote lang="la">Rudd. 2, 164 sq.): bis absolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni suspicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: judex absolvit injuriarum eum, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 29 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de praevaricatione absolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—In Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 22: hic (Dionem) Veneri absolvit, sibi condemnat, are <hi rend="ital">dativi commodi: from the obligation to Venus he absolves him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but condemns him to discharge that to himself</hi> (Verres).—With an abstract noun: fidem absolvit, <hi rend="ital">he acquitted them of their fidelity</hi> (to Otho), <hi rend="ital">pardoned it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n223.7" n="E" level="2"> In technical lang., <hi rend="ital">to bring a work to a close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi> (without denoting intrinsic excellence, like <hi rend="ital">perficere;</hi> the fig. is prob. derived from detaching a finished web from the loom; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem dissolutam divulsamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 188</bibl></cit>).—So of the sacrificial cake: <cit><quote lang="la">liba absoluta (as taken from the pan),</quote> <trans><tr>ready</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but esp. freq. in Cic.: ut pictor nemo esset inventus, qui Coae Veneris eam partem, quam Apelles inchoatam reliquisset, absolveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 3</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 19 al.</bibl>—So in Sallust repeatedly, both with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, of an historical statement, <hi rend="ital">to bring to a conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera quam paucissumis absolvam, J. 17, 2: multa paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Hist. 1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. Hist. 1</bibl></cit>, n. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">de Catilinae conjuratione paucis absolvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc locorum situm, quantum ratio sinit, absolvam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">brought to a conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi> (cf. absolvo, E.). </sense><sense id="n223.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec appellatur vita beata nisi confecta atque absoluta,</quote> <trans><tr>when not completed and concluded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfecte absolutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">absolutus et perfectus per se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:26:94 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 26, 94 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 18, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n223.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n223.10" n="1" level="3"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">unrestricted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconditional</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi videor videre, esse quasdam cum adjunctione necessitudines, quasdam simplices et absolutas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n223.11" n="2" level="3"> In gram. </sense><sense id="n223.12" n="a" level="4"> Nomen absolutum, <hi rend="ital">which gives a complete sense without any thing annexed</hi>, e. g.: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 581</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n223.13" n="b" level="4"> Verbum absolutum, in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 795</bibl> P., <hi rend="ital">that has no case with it;</hi> in <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 333</bibl> P., opp. inchoativum.—</sense><sense id="n223.14" n="c" level="4"> Adjectivum absolutum, <hi rend="ital">which stands in the positive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 19</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏlūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi> (syn. perfecte), <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrictedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolutely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:34 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 34 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absone: <entryFree id="n224" type="main" key="abso^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. absonus <sense id="n224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
absonus: <entryFree id="n225" type="main" key="abso^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n225.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Deviating from the right tone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discordant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissonant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inharmonious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quidam ita voce absoni, ut ... in oratorum numerum venire non possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox absona atque absurda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n225.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">not harmonizing with a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not accordant with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incongruous;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or ( = alienus) with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec absoni a voce motus erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil absonum fidei divinae originis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunis absona dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 112</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil absonum, nihil agreste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 107</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 32</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">absŏnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">discordantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incongruously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absorbeo: <entryFree id="n226" type="main" key="absorbe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ab-sorbĕo</orth>, <itype>bui, rarely psi, ptum</itype> (absorbui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58</bibl>: <sense id="n226.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">absorpsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. Vel. Long. 2233 P.), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to swallow down any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to devour.</hi> </sense><sense id="n226.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. Pun. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. Pun. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceanus vix videtur tot res tam cito absorbere potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placentas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 240</bibl> K. and H. (al. <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>sorbere and <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>sorbere): unionem, Plin. l. l. (Sill. <hi rend="ital">ob-</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">res ad victum,</quote> <trans><tr>to devour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n226.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to engross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absorb</hi>: hunc absorbuit aestus gloriae,<cb n="ABST" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: ipse ad sese jamdudum vocat, et quodam modo absorbet orationem meam, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eats up my discourse</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">wishes it to treat of him only</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 13</bibl>: ea (meretrix) acerrume aestuosa absorbet, <hi rend="ital">devours</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">squanders one's property</hi>, the figure taken from the sea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
absorptio: <entryFree id="n227" type="hapax" key="absorpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absorptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>absorbeo</etym>, per met., <sense id="n227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beverage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
abspello: <entryFree id="n228" type="main" key="abspello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-pello, -porto</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-portatio</orth>, v. asp-.</entryFree>
absque: <entryFree id="n229" type="main" key="absque1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-que</orth>, <sense id="n229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prep. gov. abl.</hi> [from abs and the generalizing -que, like susque deque from sub and de; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 999</bibl> P.] (ante- and post - class.), <hi rend="ital">without.</hi> </sense><sense id="n229.1" n="I" level="1"> Ante-class. </sense><sense id="n229.2" n="A" level="2"> Denoting defect in conception, while the class. <hi rend="ital">sine</hi> indicates defect in reality. In Plaut. and Ter. only in conditional clauses: absque me, te, eo, etc., esset = nisi <hi rend="ital">or</hi> si ego, tu, is, etc.. non fuissem; <hi rend="ital">without me</hi>, i. e. without my agency, <hi rend="ital">if it had not been for me</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam hercle absque me foret et meo praesidio, hic faceret te prostibilem,</quote> <trans><tr>if I had not stood by you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 3</bibl>: nam absque ted esset, numquam hodie ad solem occasum viverem, <hi rend="ital">if you had not aided me</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque eo esset, recte ego mihi vidissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>. Somewhat different is, quam fortunatus ceteris sum rebus, absque una hac foret, <hi rend="ital">if it were not for this one thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n229.3" n="B" level="2"> After Plaut. and Ter., absque appears in the classic lang. only a few times in a kind of jurid. formula: absque sententiā, <hi rend="ital">without judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam a me epistulam ad te sino absque argumento ac sententiā pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an etiamsi nullā ratione ductus est, impetu raptus sit et absque sententiā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n229.4" n="II" level="1"> Post-class. </sense><sense id="n229.5" n="A" level="2"> Likewise in jurid. lang., i. q. sine, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>: decerni absque libelli documento, Cod. Th. 11, 30, 40; so, <cit><quote lang="la">absque praejudicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque ullā observatione, Cod. Th. 13, 5, 38: absque omni praerogativā principum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n229.6" n="B" level="2"> I. q. praeter, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Aeschylum eundem esse versum absque paucis syllabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 18</bibl></cit> (19), 4; so, <cit><quote lang="la">absque paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:36" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: absque his, Cod. Th. 6, 4, 18; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 16, 17: purpureus absque caudā,</quote> <trans><tr>except the tail</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, = praeterquam, nisi: <cit><quote lang="la">absque labra,</quote> <trans><tr>except the lips</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">absque illud nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:18" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n230" type="main" key="absque2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">absque</orth> = et abs: loca, templa ... eorum relinquatis absque his abeatis, Form. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9</bibl>.</entryFree>
abstantia: <entryFree id="n231" type="hapax" key="abstanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>absto</etym>, <sense id="n231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abstemius: <entryFree id="n232" type="main" key="abste_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-tēmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. temetum and temulentus</etym>, <sense id="n232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abstaining from intoxicating drinks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sober</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/oinos</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n232.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sicca atque abstemia, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 68, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres, Varr. ap. Non. ib.: vina fugit gaudetque meris abstemius undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:323 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 323 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n232.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen.: i. q. sobrius, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstinent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstemius, herbis vivis et urticā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—Pleon.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres vini abstemiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 54, § 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n232.3" n="B" level="2"> In later Lat. = jejunus, <hi rend="ital">who is yet fasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">has not breakfasted</hi>, Aus. Idyll. praef. 11.</sense></entryFree>
abstentio: <entryFree id="n233" type="main" key="abstenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abstineo</etym>, <sense id="n233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the holding back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abstentus: <entryFree id="n234" type="main" key="abstentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abstineo.</entryFree>
abstergeo: <entryFree id="n235" type="main" key="absterge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-tergĕo</orth>, <itype>rsi, rsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (the form <sense id="n235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abstergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gĕre</hi> rests upon spurious readings, except in eccl. Lat., as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 21, 4</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to wipe off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry by wiping.</hi> </sense><sense id="n235.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">labellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: lacrimas, Lucil. ap. Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: everrite aedīs, abstergete araneas, <hi rend="ital">brush away</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 192, 10</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n235.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos (qs. to wipe away, i. e.),</quote> <trans><tr>to break</tr>, <tr>to dash to pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n235.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wipe away</hi> (any thing disagreeable, a passion, etc.), i. e. <hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi absterserunt omnem sorditudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.: dolorem, Q. Fr. 2, 9: senectutis molestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 1</bibl></cit>: <pb n="12" /> <cb n="ABST" /> metum, Fam. 9, 16; <cit><quote lang="la">luctum, Tusc. 3, 18: suspicionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
absterreo: <entryFree id="n236" type="main" key="absterre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive away by terrifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frighten away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deter</hi> (by fear): <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 74</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 3, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem a congressu meo neque janitor meus neque somnus absterruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines a pecuniis capiendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de frumento anseres absterreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 41</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">simple abl.</hi>: lenonem aedibus, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneros animos vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 128</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 45 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n236.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> with an abstract object, <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula amoris sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1064</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satum genitalem cuiquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 846</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
abstersus: <entryFree id="n237" type="main" key="abstersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of abstergeo.</entryFree>
abstinax: <entryFree id="n238" type="hapax" key="absti^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstĭnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = abstinens, <sense id="n238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abstinent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:42" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:47" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
abstinens: <entryFree id="n239" type="main" key="absti^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. abstineo.</entryFree>
abstinenter: <entryFree id="n240" type="main" key="absti^nenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstĭnenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>abstineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <sense id="n240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
abstinentia: <entryFree id="n241" type="main" key="absti^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abstĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>abstineo</etym>, <sense id="n241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abstinence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">self-restraint</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the quality by means of which one abstains from unlawful desires</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acts</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">freedom from covetousness</hi> (se ab re abstinet); it always has reference to the outward object from which one restrains himself; while the syn. <hi rend="ital">continentia</hi> designates merely subjective self-restraint. Yet as early as Cic. these ideas passed into each other, <hi rend="ital">abstinentia</hi> being used for <hi rend="ital">continentia</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">continentia</hi>—referring to an object—taking the place of <hi rend="ital">abstinentia</hi>). </sense><sense id="n241.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a refraining from</hi> any thing: conciliare benevolentiam multitudinis abstinentiā et continentiā, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by not violating the right of property</hi> (alieno abstinent) <hi rend="ital">and by self-control</hi> (se continent), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possum multa dicere de provinciali in eo magistratu abstinentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Rosc. 17</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n241.2" n="II" level="1"> In later Lat., <hi rend="ital">abstinence from food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starvation</hi> = inedia (v. abstineo): <cit><quote lang="la">vitam abstinentiā finivit,</quote> <trans><tr>he ended his life by starvation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:77:9" default="NO">77, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">febrem quiete et abstinentiā mitigavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:55:80 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 55, 80 al.</bibl>—From</sense></entryFree>
abstineo: <entryFree id="n242" type="main" key="absti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">abs-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, tentum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>teneo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to keep off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold at a distance.</hi> In the comic writers and Cic. this verb is in most cases purely active, hence constr. with <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">se</hi>) <hi rend="ital">re</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab re;</hi> the neuter signif. first became prevalent in the Aug. per. = se abstinere. </sense><sense id="n242.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ted abstineas nuptā, viduā, virgine, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanis rebus te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 132</bibl>: manus a muliere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 325, 32</bibl>;
